title: Train Simulator
notes: Some routes/trains don't work. Some Quick Drive routes tested to work: London-Brighton with Class 377, and HST. West Coast Main Line works with Class 86 and Class 390, though missing some overhead signal gantries (signal itself visible). Hagen Siegen works with ICE 1 and DB101. Isle of Wight works with Class 377, though missing water textures at Ryde Pier Head.

title: Train Simulator
notes: On highest graphics setting, some far away landscape does not get rendered

title: Train Simulator
notes: Quick startup and running fine with sound etc.

title: Train Simulator
notes: Crashes with error: Failed to create dump file 'Z:\TempDump\v62.8b.dmp' (error 3)

title: Train Simulator
notes:
I can confirm that much more of the DLC works, by manually unzipping the .ap files that RailWorks uses for its content. 

Use the following command in your terminal to find the .ap files in your RailWorks folder and unzip them:

find .local/share/Steam/steamapps/common/RailWorks/ -name "*.ap" -execdir unzip '{}' ';'

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX 580 Series (POLARIS10, DRM 3.19.0, 4.14.69-1-MANJARO, LLVM 6.0.1)
notes: Won't start. Error : Failed to create dump file 'Z:\TempDump\v62.8b.dmp' (error 3)
title: Train Simulator

notes: All the DLC I've tryed works after manually unzipping the .ap files.
title: Train Simulator

notes: Some corrupted fonts in HUD, otherwise fine, tested WCML and New York-New Haven  (64-bit version is borked, doesn't even start)
title: Train Simulator 2019

notes: 64 bit works if you use the 64 bit version of OpenAl32, it is located under Install/OpenAL/64bit and copy to the Railworks main folder. 32 bit will no longer work, unless you then use 32 bit OpenAL, to enable that you must use the 32 bit version (located in a similar place as the 64 bit). Also, follow the other users explanation on expanding the .ap files.
title: Train Simulator 2019
